comments.name: MATERIAL
comments.text:
As far as visible during the inspection areas of the structure include:
Typical wood framing

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all exterior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Recommend caulking/sealing all wall penetrations and any intersections between building materials
Refinish stucco cracking where needed.
Deteriorated brick/ mortar noted at the front right corner of home. Damage caused from improper termination of down spout. Recommend repairing.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior trim:
Loose/sagging vinyl soffit trim Noted and front of home. 
Missing fascia trim noted and front right of home. 
Damaged fascia trim noted above bird box at rear of home.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Slab is not fully visible.
The following concerns were noted at the slab:
Typical cracks in slab noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age.Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Typical corner cracking noted.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the landscaping:
Maintenance needed
Trim plants away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.
Trees are touching/overhanging the roof.  Damage is possible. Trim plants and trees away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replace as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text:
Front Porch and Rear Patio:
Same as structure, open design

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the patio/porch cover:
Damage/Deterioration noted at base of posts at front porch. Consult with a qualified professional and make repairs/corrections/improvements as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior stairs:
Missing/damaged bricks noted to front exterior stairs. Consult with a qualified professional and make repairs/corrections/improvements as needed.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.
The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Damaged shingles noted at the right side of the roof on the front gable, at the left end of the main ridge and the front end of the garage ridge. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and 
repair/replace.
Previous repairs noted. Verify reason with seller and monitor for on-going or future problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the flashings:
Missing end caps at some of the ridge vent flashing. Recommend  installing. 
Recommend sealing at the joints in the ridge vent flashing.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text:
Full
The following concerns were noted at the gutters:
Debris in the gutters Recommend cleaning.
Missing/damaged downspout ends install where needed.

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text:
Main line is 3/4 inch diameter 
Copper

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Main water shut off valve is located at the meter. No other shut off valve was visible during the home inspection. Check with sellers to determine if another shut off valve is present.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable, valve not tested, water pressure appears adequate.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Plumbing vents appear serviceable

comments.name: METER/TANK LOCATION-CONDITION
comments.text:
Meter located at the rear of the building

System appears serviceable

comments.name: GENERAL INFORMATION
comments.text: This property appears to have a septic system installed.  Inspection of septic systems is considered beyond the normal scope of a home inspection.  Any additional information regarding this system has been included as a courtesy to our clients and should not be considered an exhaustive inspection.  It is highly recommended that the system be inspected by a qualified licensed contractor prior to closing.  Some jurisdictions may require this before a property transfer can be completed.  Consult with your real estate professional for further information.

comments.name: SYSTEM CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable.
Recommend further evaluation by a qualified specialist prior to closing.

comments.text:
Accessible switches and receptacles were tested.  As a whole receptacles and switches throughout the building are in serviceable condition.
The following concerns were noted with the switches and receptacles:
Several missing cover plates. Recommend replacing.

comments.text: Accessible lights were tested.  As a whole lighting throughout the building is in serviceable condition.

comments.text:

Whirlpool tub was only operable when button was held down. Consult with a qualified professional and make repairs/corrections/improvements as needed.

Bathroom exhaust vent terminates into the attic insulation. Recommend routing to the exterior.

comments.text:

The toilet is loose at floor. A new wax seal should be installed under loose toilets. Flange may be broken. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair.
The toilet does not flush properly and needs repair.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair or replace.

comments.name: INTERIOR DOORS
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior doors:
Left closet rear bedroom door doesn’t not latch properly. Recommend repair/replacing latching hardware

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible windows were inspected.  Windows as a grouping are generally operational and appear serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the windows:
Chipped/cracked glass at the window in the dinning room and in the living room windows at the front of home. Broken window noted in laundry room. Consult with a qualified professional and make repairs/corrections/improvements as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Typical signs of wear noted from normal occupancy. Minor repairs, caulking and paint touch-up recommended.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the ceilings:
Moisture stains/damage noted in several areas. No abnormal moisture readings at the time of the inspection. Recommend cleaning, treating and repainting the areas.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with the floors:
missing transitions
Carpet is loose/stained/wrinkled. Recommend replacing/stretching/cleaning.
Cracking at the flooring near the rear entry repair as needed

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Interior stairs appear serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: LOCATION - TYPE - CONDITION
comments.text:
Location: Living room
Type: Prefabricated metal
Fuel source: Gas insert
Fireplace appears serviceable.

comments.name: ACCESSIBILITY
comments.text:
Attic is mostly accessible/was entered for inspection. However due to the inherent design of attic spaces some areas are not conducive to inspection.
Consider installing additional access on right side of house

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Evidence of prior rodent activity is visible in the attic. You may wish to have treatment carried out by a licensed exterminator.

comments.name: VENTILATION
comments.text: Attic ventilation is provided by Soffit vents and Ridge vents

comments.name: VAPOR BARRIER CONDITION
comments.text: Vapor barrier was not visible during inspection.

Missing/removed detectors noted
We suggest additional smoke detectors be installed in appropriate locations

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text: Gas Cooktop and a Separate Electric Wall Mounted Oven

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable. A normal wash cycle was run at the time of the inspection. No leaking noted. No other cycles were tested at the time of the inspection.

comments.text: Laundry plumbing was not tested. We highly recommend verifying proper operation of plumbing before close of transaction.

comments.text: 240V Service-operational and the electrical outlet is grounded

comments.name: POWER SOURCE
comments.text:
240 Volt
Electrical disconnect present

Loose conduit leaving wiring exposed at the unit recommend re securing.

comments.name: GENERAL CONDITION OF CONDENSER - COMPRESSOR
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted with the air conditioning condenser/compressor:
Unit appears to be using R-22 refrigerant. The unit could be nearing the end of its service life. Recommend consulting with a licensed HVAC contractor on the maintenance of an older unit. Make any recommend repairs or replace as needed.

comments.name: INTERIOR AIR TEMPERATURE DROP
comments.text: Less than 12 degrees F- Cooling not adequate

comments.name: EVAPORATOR COIL CONDITION
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the interior AC system:
Unit is not cooling properly. Most notably in the right side bedrooms and bathroom. Recommend servicing the system, checking the refrigerant levels, and making any recommended repairs.Replace the unit as needed.

comments.name: EVAPORATOR CONDENSATE LINE AND/PAN
comments.text:
Condensate line installed.
Float switch noted/not tested
Insulation noted in pan which may clog drain line or inhibit proper operation of the float switch. Recommend cleaning pan.
No visible drain line installed on pan
